This is a good question and I am pretty much letting my kids do whatever they want on the Internet. I was always told TV would rot my brain but I think I'm ok so I'm pretty sure my kids will be fine. I was talking to my 15yo daughter the other day and she mentioned tentacle porn. She didn't understand why people would watch that and I explained to her about Japanese censorship laws which basically led to it. My 12yo daughter watches lots of my little pony but is now getting into anime like my older one. My 7yo boy plays roblox and watches Minecraft videos all day. He knows to stay away from the "bad" websites but I'm sure one day he will get curious and I will know. We do make them turn in their phones and tablets at bedtime so they don't stay up all night.

My dad was an alcoholic also and it sucked growing up like that. He finally quit drinking when I was around 15 because one of his buddies got killed drinking and driving but the damage was already done at that point. I told myself I would never do that to my kids if I ever had any.

Saw a house engulfed in flames one night on my way home from work. There was no fire department around, no cops, no neighbors outside and there were other houses nearby. I was imagining a family being burned alive while they slept. Thankfully later I found out the house was empty because of earlier flood damage. Apparently the heaters and fans they were using to dry the place overloaded the wiring and caught on fire...they didn't have flood insurance but luckily they had fire insurance, go figure.
My kids and my wife think I'm amazing also! Thank you

It's not gonna happen. This whole going to Mars thing people are fantasizing about right now is a bunch of wishful thinking. Yea it's real nice to say you want to go to Mars but actually doing it would be suicide. Let's say you somehow survive the radiation on the way there, wtf are you going to do once you get there and realize you are on your own? You won't be able to run to the store and buy more bottled water or food or medecine or sanity. What purpose does sending humans to Mars have besides saying we did it?

The pic of the two badges in your hand, the one on the right is a British tank badge. Found this with a quick google search: It's a British Army cap/hat/ beret badge for RTR (Royal Tank Regt) or RTC (Royal Tank Corps) with the Kings crown, Kings Crown Badge as worn in WWII, But in service from 1924 to 1953
Oh man that looks like fun! I was a member of the Fairbanks cycle club a long time ago and we went on many rides that looked like this...now I'm stuck in Texas.

Not gonna lie...I have been pissed off at my MTB all summer and haven't ridden it since April. My last ride I did 40 miles but should have done 65 that day. I trained my ass off all previous fall and that winter to get ready for the Ouachita Challenge in Arkansas. I got sick with some viral upper respiratory thing a week before the event and hadn't fully recovered by the ride time. Lately though I want to start riding again but every time it rains here in Texas they shut down the trails for at least a week and it sucks living here.

I've had an aluminum frame break (specialized) so it happens. They replaced my frame under warranty and I never had another problem with it. I've never had a carbon bike but I am assuming if you bought from a reputable company they will have some type of warranty as well, it would be worth doing your research on the companies website before you buy.

Not gonna sugar coat it...it's a weird pic. It appears you are out in a forest and the question is what is up with those rocks? They don't "belong" out there. Also it looks like you just walked up and zoomed in a little with your lens and snapped a pic...not much effort or preplanning went into this shot and I can tell. If you want to take more "good" pics take a look at www.photo.net to get some ideas. The good news is it can only get better from here

To me the scene could do without the entire left side from just a little left of center. Also the light is not ideal in the background. There is too much contrast between the sunny areas and the darker rocks in mid image. I think the colors in the foliage would show up better if the sky was overcast and that would also solve your contrast issue. Maybe I'm used to seeing overly photoshopped images and thinking those look nice. Anyway, it looks like a very cool place and I wish I was there!
